title.rendered: Home Office Storage Solutions to Make Life Easier

content.rendered:
Working from home is the new normal in Vaughan, and more people are struggling to make their home offices functional and aesthetically pleasing. Finding enough storage space in a home office can be difficult, especially if you are working from a small apartment. If you have a partner who also works from home, office space is likely a premium. Whether you work from a whole room or you have set up your office in an area of your kitchen, ensuring you have the best storage solutions is essential. Here are six office storage solutions to make your work and home life more manageable. 

1. Keep Your Desk Simple

The desk is the focal point of any office, and it can make or break the functionality of a space. Your desk should be neat and always organized. A desk overflowing with papers and food wrappers can overwhelm a small area quickly. Keep clutter off the desk’s surface with a pen cup, document folders, stacked drawers, and a magazine holder. Keep the surface of your desk as clean as possible and store paper and notebooks in or under the desk. You’ll feel a lot better, and your productivity will go up if you take a few minutes to organize your desk at the end of each day. 

2. Bring in Shelving

Not all home offices are blessed with large shelving units and cabinets. If you don’t have them, create them! Installing a few open shelves can add storage and style to a small home office space. Choose an empty wall and install neutral-coloured shelves that can hold both documents and decorations. Keep the shelves a neutral colour so you can add items of visual interest without overwhelming the space. Keeping documents off the floor with hanging shelves helps small spaces feel larger and more organized. 

3. Use Cubbies 

Do you need storage solutions in Vaughan for clients who visit your office? A cubby system can be a great storage solution for large or misshapen items. Cubbies are easy to install and can add a lot of visual interest to an otherwise bland space. Make sure the cubbies you install are symmetrical and properly aligned to give the appearance of organization. You can slide colourful decorative baskets into the cubby holes to secure items that you do not want to display openly. 

4. Rent a Storage Unit

If you own a small business that carries inventory, it may be necessary to rent a storage unit to free up space in your home. Keep stock and items that are not used daily in a nearby storage unit to streamline day-to-day operations. Cluttering your home office with things you do not use daily not only creates an unnecessary mess but can also cause stress. Many storage units offer introductory pricing to new customers, making it an affordable option. 

5. Hide Your Storage

Not all items should be displayed for everyone to see. To maintain a clean and functional look, utilize hidden storage solutions that keep things out of sight but still within reach. Using storage benches can hide clutter while providing more seating options. 

6. Use Drawer Dividers

Organize your office supplies by type and designate drawers for specific items. You can further classify and organize your desk using drawer dividers. Expandable drawer dividers are an excellent option for smaller items that are often replaced, like pens, pencils, and printer paper. 

Work With Handyman Connection

A functional home office is crucial for any person who regularly works from home. Handyman Connection specializes in home renovations in Vaughan, including home office solutions. Our electricians can add new outlets for computers or install new lighting fixtures to brighten up your office. Our team of carpenters can install shelving solutions, including bookcases or a walk-in closet for your home office. Contact us today to create a functional, stylish home office space.
